tags: aristotle and dante discover the secrets of the universe
summary: tyrus as ari and dante
title: tyrus as ari and dante
body:
™ okay so i just finished reading aristotle and dante discover the secrets of the universe AND ITS SO GOOD EVERYBODY GO READ IT

anyways,,, lets get to the bread: TYRUS

TJ would ovbiously be Ari:

  • because he’s mean. 
  • except that he’s not that mean.
  • u need to peel back his layers
  • like an onion 
  • and oblivous to his own feelings.
  • First Move™
  • Thinks He Is Straight
  • family trouble? 
  • dogs
  • braveness and punching bullies that beats people up
  • athletic!!!
  • Just Another Attractive Jock
  • he’s smart but he doesn’t belive it.
  • kind of needs more friends
  • l o n e l y   a f 😓
  • would totally drive an old red pickup 
  • “how could i ever be ashamed of loving cyrus goodman?”

Cyrus would be Dante:

  • sweet, annoying, a dreamer AND a softie, 
  • knows wayy to many old and long words
  • p o e t i c   a n d   a r t 
  • GAY™
  • losing his shoe 
  • cool parents
  • therapist mom.
  • cyrus is the type of guyto write long letters and asking way too personal questions. 
  • also the first to realise his feelings
  • totally not normal but in a good way
  • kiss me. no. kiss me! no! u kiss me

summary: The Shoe Theory
title: The Shoe Theory
body:
Cyrus puked in his shoe while on a double date with Iris. He stepped in a mud puddle with Buffy and Andi.

What does this mean?

Iris and Jonah weren’t right for Cyrus, and neither were Buffy or Andi.

———

“what about TJ?”

simple. Yes he lost a shoe while with TJ, but it was TJ that found it. This indicated that while they would have conflict. it doesn’t mean they won’t be together like with the rest, but that TJ would solve the conflict, and fix their relationship. edit=> thinking back, Cyrus may have found the shoe. The point still rests though. The shoe was found while being with TJ. TJ could have done anything, but it was up to Cyrus to forgive me. So if Cyrus found the shoe, it foreshadowed that Cyrus would forgive TJ.

————

“TJ offered Buffy shoes though”

But Buffy said no. Proof that Tuffy would never happen. TJ may also be in the closet and trying to deny his feelings for Cyrus, even if he is terrible at hiding them.

——–

Cyrus hasn’t a lost a shoe with TJ since than.

———

Walker made shoes for both Andi and Buffy but they didn’t want it

hence, no endgame for Walker with Andi or Buffy

———-

Buffy and Marty had conflict. She broke his heart, and wrecked his shoes. I know she gave new shoes before she friendzoned him but that was her fixing her previous conflict,and besides he gave her shoelaces in the time capsule. A symbol that they aren’t where they were- but its more than they had before. They will progress. Theres time for more shoes to be mentioned.


Inconclusion, shoes are a symbol of love and I desperately need a life.

blog.name: heyoricohannah
blog.title: “I’m pretty petty and that’s a pity”
blog.description:
http://archiveofourown.org/users/

Hudstrige1

summary: Cyrus is not the kind of person that would lie so he was telling the truth when he said he didn't like Jonah anymore
question: Cyrus is not the kind of person that would lie so he was telling the truth when he said he didn't like Jonah anymore
answer:
You know, I would write my own little Drabble for this, but I’ve seen you already sent the same thing to Samone, and I can’t beat her skills, so…Oh, fuck it. Why not?



Jonah doesn’t know what to do with this news, anymore. Did. Cyrus did like him, but not anymore. What the hell was that about? Did he do something wrong? God, he must’ve done something wrong. He’s starting to feel like how Cyrus did when he-Jonah-went up to talk to him about Iris liking him, and that double date with Amber. Where he repeatedly ask what he did wrong and apologized. What did he do wrong?! Absolutely nothing at all. In fact, Cyrus is currently meeting him at The Spoon to tell him exactly this.

“Hey.” He gently scoots in across from him.

“Hey-I just wanted to say: I don’t think it’s weird that you used to like me or anything. It’s kinda cute, actually. And why you stopped liking me is none of my business.” Jonah’s abruptly frazzling.

For once, this isn’t about his insecurities. It’s not about the fact that someone lost their romantic attraction towards him. The same thing happened with Andi, and Amber, and Libby, but does he let that negatively affect him? No. The difference here, is that it’s Cyrus.

It’s Cyrus, and he just wishes he had known so he could realize his own feelings towards him sooner. He’s aware he’s lost his chance by now, and that’s okay. Okay it’s not. He’s been crying about it ever since he found out about Cyrus’ former feelings, but it’s not like he can tell Cyrus ‘hey, I wish I could’ve been with you.’ That would totally ruin their friendship and he is not here for that.

“That’s kinda what I wanted to talk to you about.”

“Whatever I did that was so bad-“

“You did absolutely nothing, Jonah. Trust me.”

“Was that it? Was I being so oblivious that you got sick me? ‘Cause-“ he chuckles spitefully. “Believe me, I get that.”

“No…” Cyrus smiles. “I mean…It wasn’t you that did anything wrong. It was me.”

“But,” Jonah doesn’t understand. “How-“

“Remember that day you tried out for Ultimate? The travel team?”

“Yeah…”

“Well, it was after you saw you didn’t make it. You called me a good friend, and,”

“But, I’ve made comments like that before, right?” Jonah recalls.

“Yeah, but…I guess that one really got to me. I guess it just made me think…I really would never have a chance with you. So I was in denial.”

“Believe me Cyrus I was in denial.” Jonah promises. “About how I felt.” He’s taken this in rather smoothly.

“Well…” Cyrus can’t wipe the humungous smile off his face. “I guess that made two of us. But, not anymore.”

“Yeah.” Jonah beams. “Not anymore.”

No more excuses.

He’s starting to feel like how Cyrus did when he-Jonah-went up to talk to him about Iris liking him, and that double date with Amber. Where he repeatedly ask what he did wrong and apologized. What did he do wrong?! Absolutely nothing at all. In fact, Cyrus is currently meeting him at The Spoon to tell him exactly this.

“Hey.” He gently scoots in across from him.

“Hey-I just wanted to say: I don’t think it’s weird that you used to like me or anything. It’s kinda cute, actually. And why you stopped liking me is none of my business.” Jonah’s abruptly frazzling.

For once, this isn’t about his insecurities. It’s not about the fact that someone lost their romantic attraction towards him. The same thing happened with Andi, and Amber, and Libby, but does he let that negatively affect him? No. The difference here, is that it’s Cyrus.

It’s Cyrus, and he just wishes he had known so he could realize his own feelings towards him sooner. He’s aware he’s lost his chance by now, and that’s okay. Okay it’s not. He’s been crying about it ever since he found out about Cyrus’ former feelings, but it’s not like he can tell Cyrus ‘hey, I wish I could’ve been with you.’ That would totally ruin their friendship and he is not here for that.

“That’s kinda what I wanted to talk to you about.”

“Whatever I did that was so bad-“

“You did absolutely nothing, Jonah. Trust me.”

“Was that it? Was I being so oblivious that you got sick me? ‘Cause-“ he chuckles spitefully. “Believe me, I get that.”

“No…” Cyrus smiles. “I mean…It wasn’t you that did anything wrong. It was me.”

“But,” Jonah doesn’t understand. “How-“

“Remember that day you tried out for Ultimate? The travel team?”

“Yeah…”

“Well, it was after you saw you didn’t make it. You called me a good friend, and,”

“But, I’ve made comments like that before, right?” Jonah recalls.

“Yeah, but…I guess that one really got to me. I guess it just made me think…I really would never have a chance with you. So I was in denial.”

“Believe me Cyrus I was in denial.” Jonah promises. “About how I felt.” He’s taken this in rather smoothly.

“Well…” Cyrus can’t wipe the humungous smile off his face. “I guess that made two of us. But, not anymore.”

“Yeah.” Jonah beams. “Not anymore.”

No more excuses.
trail.content:

For once, this isn’t about his insecurities. It’s not about the fact that someone lost their romantic attraction towards him. The same thing happened with Andi, and Amber, and Libby, but does he let that negatively affect him? No. The difference here, is that it’s Cyrus.

It’s Cyrus, and he just wishes he had known so he could realize his own feelings towards him sooner. He’s aware he’s lost his chance by now, and that’s okay. Okay it’s not. He’s been crying about it ever since he found out about Cyrus’ former feelings, but it’s not like he can tell Cyrus ‘hey, I wish I could’ve been with you.’ That would totally ruin their friendship and he is not here for that.

“Whatever I did that was so bad-“

“You did absolutely nothing, Jonah. Trust me.”

“Was that it? Was I being so oblivious that you got sick me? ‘Cause-“ he chuckles spitefully. “Believe me, I get that.”

“No…” Cyrus smiles. “I mean…It wasn’t you that did anything wrong. It was me.”

“But,” Jonah doesn’t understand. “How-“

“Yeah…”

“Well, it was after you saw you didn’t make it. You called me a good friend, and,”

“But, I’ve made comments like that before, right?” Jonah recalls.

“Yeah, but…I guess that one really got to me. I guess it just made me think…I really would never have a chance with you. So I was in denial.”

“Believe me Cyrus I was in denial.” Jonah promises. “About how I felt.” He’s taken this in rather smoothly.

“Yeah.” Jonah beams. “Not anymore.”

No more excuses.
